articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel prepared on Saturday to receive six more hostages from Gaza in exchange for hundreds of Palestinian prisoners and detainees, after accusations over the return of a misidentified body this week threatened to derail a fragile truce.
articles.title: Israel prepares to receive six more Gaza hostages

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: The man arrested after a Spanish tourist was stabbed at Berlin's Holocaust memorial on Friday was a 19-year-old Syrian refugee, Berlin prosecutors said, a day before a national election in which concerns over migration are expected to boost the far-right AfD party.
articles.title: Syrian refugee arrested after Berlin stabbing as Germany prepares to vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A second meeting between representatives of Russia and the United States is planned for the next two weeks, the RIA state news agency reported on Saturday, citing Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov.
articles.title: Russia, U.S. representatives to meet again within two weeks, senior Russian diplomat says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: In a ruined Soviet-era apartment block in Pisky, near the east Ukrainian city of Donetsk, huge chunks of roof and walls lie scattered about the floor where Maria Seryogova once played with her baby grandson.
articles.title: Villagers in Russian-controlled Ukraine visit homes destroyed in long conflict

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: The Vatican said Francis, who was diagnosed with double pneumonia, suffered a breathing crisis and needed blood transfusions.
articles.title: Pope Francis in critical condition after health worsens, Vatican says

articles.author: Cecile Mantovani
articles.description: Around 250 people protested on Saturday against the leader of the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party in the Swiss town where she has a home, sparking counter-demonstrations in a charged atmosphere that led to five arrests, authorities said.
articles.title: Hundreds protest at Swiss home of German far-right leader

articles.author: Anita Komuves, Krisztina Fenyo
articles.description: Thousands of Hungarian judges, court staff and supporters marched to the ministry of justice in Budapest on Saturday, demanding judicial independence, freedom of expression for judges and better pay.
articles.title: Hungarian judges, court staff rally for judicial independence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Donald Trump said on Saturday the United States is close an agreement with Ukraine on sharing revenue from Ukrainian minerals as part of efforts to end the Ukraine war.
articles.title: Trump says US 'pretty close' to minerals deal with Ukraine

articles.author: Stoyan Nenov
articles.description: Several thousand supporters of Bulgaria's ultra-nationalist Revival party scuffled with police on Saturday while trying to storm the building of a European Union mission during a protest against the country's plans to adopt the euro next year.
articles.title: Bulgaria's anti-euro protesters try to storm EU mission building

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Congolese President Felix Tshisekedi will launch a unity government, his spokesperson said on Saturday, as he faces domestic pressure over his handling of an offensive by Rwanda-backed M23 rebels in eastern provinces.
articles.title: Congo president plans unity government in response to eastern crisis
